page.title: 04THE ECOLOGY OF THE AREA
page.content: Comberton and Toft have a rural ecology. In Comberton there are 7 rubbish bins.In Toft there are 9 bins,though those by the the bus shelter are not that well used.Rubbish is still being dropped. Wood shavings,sponge scraps, laces, tins and paper are thrown away. There are 11 footpaths in Comberton. One going from the bridge to the rec. it was made in 1967.Another path went through a farmers land.At first the entrance was wired off but recently has been opened.Most paths have easy access,but one path was sown over, another path is blocked off.In Toft paths go from one lane to another. Some of the natural history that appear in the two villages are birds foot trefoil,sycamore,foxes,weasels, squirrels,fieldmice,pike,snails, fieldfare,redwing and yellow wagtail.
